CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 11, 1953, pg. 31 reads: "To Play With Pittsburgh Symphony, Jr. - Here are scenes as ninety-one young instrumentalists from Pittsburgh area high schools, who were named to the Pittsburgh Symphony, Jr., were directed in their first rehearsal on Easter Monday morning at Taylor-Allderdice High School Auditorium, in preparation for their joint appearance on stage with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra at Syria Mosque on Tuesday, April 14, with William Steinberg conducting. The talented young musicians will participate with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra in a new type of concert in which they will be matched chair for chair with the regular orchestra.  Henry Di Cecco, senior student at Central Catholic High School, will be junior concertmaster and be seated beside Samuel Thaviu, Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra concertmaster.  Fifty per cent of the junior musicians are products of the city's public, private and parochial schools, and fifty per cent come from the county school system. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: String section of Pittsburgh Symphony Junior Orchestra rehearsing in Taylor Allderdice High School
